on_boarding_summary_1: This app provides a mobile technology-based solution for understanding chemical and biological structures
on_boarding_summary_2: The app illustrates key structures for molecular geometry, isomerism and biochemistry
on_boarding_summary_3: The app implemented printed pattern engines, 3D interactivity features and Augmented Reality technology
access_ebook_summary: Complementary texts referring to the concept of augmented reality and the chemical concepts addressed will be presented
download_targets_summary: For the visualization and analysis of chemical structures, the targets correspond to the respective molecular objects for 3D observation in Augmented Reality.
about_project_description: This project was developed by the research group L@itec - Instituto Federal de Educação, Ciência e Tecnologia de São Paulo - Câmpus Campinas in order to integrate the teaching-learning process of chemistry with the new technologies of Augmented Reality (AR). Chemistry teaching represents one of the most expressive examples of the impact that mobile technologies can promote, arousing students' curiosity to understand and visualize theories from a new perspective. Thus, the integration of smartphones with Augmented Reality applications is an innovative method of teaching spatial reasoning skills to chemistry students. Therefore, through the use of mobile devices one can take advantage of the AR application and visualize chemical molecules that illustrate molecule structures for the topics of molecular geometry, spatial isomerism and biochemical structures, being possible to analyze and understand the topic with interactivity and dynamic visualization resources.
permission_required_description: The Moléculas AR app needs permission to access the device camera. Select 'Permissions' in the app information to allow access.
